Instance.description:
The base DramaNode. This drama node handles all the functionality of scheduling the node and provides the interface for running it.
To Define your own DramaNode inherit from BaseDramaNode and override the run() to run your own custom behavior.

TunableVariant.name: additional_pack
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this drama node is only available if you have a specific pack. This should only be used if two packs are required to see the content and to have it actually function.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Pack required for this drama node to run.

Tunable.name: allow_during_work_hours
Tunable.description: If this node can be scheduled during a Sim's work hours.

TunableVariant.name: cooldown_data
TunableVariant.description: The different types of cooldowns that can be applied to this drama node.

TunableTuple.name: group_cooldown
TunableTuple.description: Put the drama node on cooldown based on a group.

TunableEnum.name: group
TunableEnum.description: The cooldown group that this drama node is a part of.

TunableTuple.name: node_cooldown
TunableTuple.description: Put the drama node on cooldown for itself.

TunableEnum.name: cooldown_option
TunableEnum.description: When this drama node should be put on cooldown.

TunableVariant.name: duration
TunableVariant.description: If this drama node will be put on cooldown for a duration or put on cooldown permanently.

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: The amount of time in hours after being given this node from scoring that it will not be chosen.

TunableTuple.name: min_and_max_times
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum times for scheduling this node. A random valid time between these two values will be selected for the actual time that this node is scheduled.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: picked_sim_info
TunableVariant.description: An optional Sim that acts as ParticipantType.PickedSim if supplied. Useful for if a third Sim is involved, e.g. a text message drama node that says "Hey, my sister <Sender's sister's Sim name> likes your hair!"

TunableTuple.name: no_participant
TunableTuple.description: , There is no participant for this drama participant.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: Use a specific participant type from the system that called this drama node to resolve this drama participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The participant type to use to resolve the drama node's participant.

TunableTuple.name: sim_filter
TunableTuple.description: Use a sim filter relative to specific participant of the system that called this drama node. Usually this participant type will be the same as the participant that is used for the receiving sim, but there can be exceptions. Ex. If a sim dies you might want a sim who is a friend of the person who died to send the message rather than a person who is a friend of the player sim that will receive this message.

TunableList.name: blacklist_participants
TunableList.description: A list of participants that will be blacklisted from the filter.

TunableEnum.description: The participant type to blacklist for the filter.

TunableEnum.name: participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The participant type to use to request the filter.

Tunable.name: sim_filter
Tunable.description: The sim filter that we will use to find the sim that will be used for this drama node's participant.

TdescFragTag.name: pretests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of specific tests that will run on the target Sim to see if they are valid for this DramaNode. These tests will be run both when scheduling the drama node and when it is about to be run.

TunableEnum.name: receiver_sim
TunableEnum.description:
The participant type to use to find who will be the receiving Sim for this DramaNode.
The receiving Sim will be the one that receives the DramaNode.

TdescFragTag.name: receiver_sim_pretests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests to run on the receiving Sim before attempting to even setup the drama node.

TunableVariant.name: reschedule_on_failed_tests
TunableVariant.description: If this node should be rescheduled to be attempted to run again if the drama node fails to run due to failed tests. This will use a seperate min and max time.

TunableTuple.name: reschedule
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum times for rescheduling this node. A random valid time between these two values will be selected for the actual time that this node is rescheduled.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TdescFragTag.name: run_tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of specific tests that will run on the target Sim to see if they are valid for this DramaNode. These tests will only be run when the drama node is about to be run.

TunableVariant.name: scoring
TunableVariant.description: If enabled this DramaNode will be scored and chosen by the drama service.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Data related to scoring this DramaNode.

Tunable.name: base_score
Tunable.description: The base score of this drama node. This score will be multiplied by the score of the different filter results used to find the Sims for this DramaNode to find the final result.

TunableEnum.name: bucket
TunableEnum.description:
Which scoring bucket should these drama nodes be scored as part of. Only Nodes in the same bucket are scored against each other.
Change different bucket settings within the Drama Node's module tuning.

TunableVariant.name: receiving_sim_scoring_filter
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will generate a score for for the receiving Sim to be factored into the scoring of this DramaNode.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The filter that we will use to generate a score for the receiving Sim.

TunableVariant.name: sender_sim_info
TunableVariant.description:
Tuning for selecting the sending Sim.
The sending Sim is considered the Sim who will be sending this DramaNode.

TunableTuple.name: no_participant
TunableTuple.description: , There is no participant for this drama participant.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: Use a specific participant type from the system that called this drama node to resolve this drama participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The participant type to use to resolve the drama node's participant.

TunableTuple.name: sim_filter
TunableTuple.description: Use a sim filter relative to specific participant of the system that called this drama node. TunableList.name: blacklist_participants
TunableList.description: A list of participants that will be blacklisted from the filter.

TunableEnum.description: The participant type to blacklist for the filter.

TunableEnum.name: participant_type
TunableEnum.description: The participant type to use to request the filter.

Tunable.name: sim_filter
Tunable.description: The sim filter that we will use to find the sim that will be used for this drama node's participant.

TunableEnum.name: sender_sim_info_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of sender sim info allowed for the drama node.

TunableList.name: tests_failed_loot
TunableList.description: A list of loot actions to apply if the tests that run when the drama node is about to be run fail. This includes both the tuned run_tests as well as any tests in the code.

Tunable.description: Loot action to apply if the run tests fail.

TunableVariant.name: time_option
TunableVariant.description: How we want to try and schedule this drama node based on time.

TunableTuple.name: schedule
TunableTuple.description: Schedule this node based on a schedule. We will pick any time valid within the schedule.

TunableList.name: valid_times
TunableList.description: The valid times that this node can be scheduled.

TunableTuple.description: The days, start time, and duration that this node is valid.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: The duration that this this node is available in hours.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

TunableTuple.name: single_time
TunableTuple.description: Only a single possible time can be selected.

TunableTuple.name: valid_time
TunableTuple.description: A single time of the week that this drama node will be available.

TunableVariant.name: ui_display_data
TunableVariant.description: Information for what should show up on the calendar

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: name
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableEnum.name: ui_display_type
TunableEnum.description: How Calendar should display this type of drama node.
